repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body: This PR closes https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/34643 ### Changes 1. Every hyperlink-like element was replaced by `"$1"` (where $1 is the original string showed in the hyperlink); 2. Arrows `--->` were used in lines containing practice examples when no editing text is involved; 3. Context on interactivity was minimally adapted when strictly needed, not to disrupt the original tutor's intent; 4. Tests regarding the tutor file refactored to ensure the new syntax is not flagged as an error. ### Test coverage The tests were executed using the command `make functionaltest`, since the changes were limited to tutor-related files and were covered exclusively by the functional tests. All ran tests succeeded, except for tests under `test/functional/terminal/`, which seem to be unrelated to the tutor files. It's important to notice that tests regarding the tutor file were refactored to ensure the new syntax is not flagged as an error. ### Screenshots - Before changes: - After changes:

comment_data.body: Is there any parsing issue with this?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -135,56 +135,56 @@ NOTE: You should notice that old full-line deletions move down the list
 1. tribute
 
 
-NOTE: Whole line deletions (`dd`{normal}) are much longer lived in the
+NOTE: Whole line deletions ("dd") are much longer lived in the
       numbered registers than whole line yanks, or deletions involving
       smaller movements
 
-REFERENCE: [Numbered Registers](quote0)
+REFERENCE: Numbered Registers
 
 
 # Lesson 2.1.5: SPECIAL REGISTERS
 
  ** Use system clipboard and blackhole registers for advanced editing **
 
  Note: Clipboard use requires a working clipboard provider for the current
-       windowing system on Linux. Check with `:checkhealth vim.provider`{vim}
-       and `:echo has('clipboard_working')`{vim}
+       windowing system on Linux. Check with ":checkhealth vim.provider"
+       and ":echo has('clipboard_working')"
 
-  1. Clipboard registers `+`{normal} and `*`{normal} :
-     - `"+y`{normal} - Yank to system clipboard (e.g. `"+yy`{normal} for current line)
-     - `"+p`{normal} - Paste from system clipboard
-     - `"*`{normal} is primary selection on X11 (middle-click), `"+`{normal} is clipboard
+  1. Clipboard registers "+" and "*" :
+     - ""+y" - Yank to system clipboard (e.g. ""+yy" for current line)
+     - ""+p" - Paste from system clipboard
+     - ""*" is primary selection on X11 (middle-click), ""+" is clipboard
 
-Try: "+yy then paste into another application with Ctrl-V or Cmd+V
+---> Try: "+yy then paste into another application with Ctrl-V or Cmd+V
 
-  2. Blackhole register `_`{normal} discards text:
-     - `"_daw`{normal} - Delete word without saving to any register
-     - Useful when you don't want to overwrite your default `"`{normal} register
+  2. Blackhole register "_" discards text:
+     - ""_daw" - Delete word without saving to any register
+     - Useful when you don't want to overwrite your default """ register
      - Note this is using the "a Word" text object, introduced in a previous
        lession
-     - `"_dd`{normal}  - Delete line without saving
-     - `"_dap`{normal} - Delete paragraph without saving
-     - Combine with counts: `3"_dw`{normal}
+     - ""_dd"  - Delete line without saving
+     - ""_dap" - Delete paragraph without saving
+     - Combine with counts: "3"_dw"
 
-Practice: "_diw on any word to delete it without affecting yank history
+---> Practice: "_diw on any word to delete it without affecting yank history
 
   3. Combine with visual selections:
-     - Select text with V then `"+y`{normal}
-     - To paste from clipboard in insert mode: `<CTRL-R>+`{normal}
+     - Select text with V then ""+y"
+     - To paste from clipboard in insert mode: "<CTRL-R>+"
      - Try opening another application and paste from clipboard
 
   4. Remember:
      - Clipboard registers work across different Vim instances
      - Clipboard register is not always working
      - Blackhole prevents accidental register overwrites
-     - Default `"`{normal} register is still available for normal yank/paste
+     - Default """ register is still available for normal yank/paste

comment_data.body:
I would personally prefer the backtick syntax, with the backtick character being concealed with a space (that would require modifying the syntax file, I believe). Using `"` and displaying it to users could cause some confusions to users when it comes to exercise where users actually have to type `"`. You can also see the old `vimtutor` for reference.

To clarify, instead of writing
```tutor
Type `daw`{normal} to delete
```
It could be rewritten as
```tutor
Type `daw` to delete
```
And it will be displayed to users as
```tutor
Type  daw  to delete
```
With the word `daw` being highlighted
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -20,64 +20,64 @@
 
   1. Practice word operations:
      - Place cursor on any word in the line below
-     - Type `diw`{normal} to delete INNER word (word without surrounding space)
-     - Type `daw`{normal} to delete A WORD (including trailing whitespace)
-     - Try with other operators: `ciw`{normal} (change), `yiw`{normal} (yank),
-        `gqiw`{normal} (format)
+     - Type "diw" to delete INNER word (word without surrounding space)

comment_data.body:
The problem with this approach is how the cursor still gets "stuck" when walking with `h` or `l` through the string. In my case, Neovim does not displays nor formats it differently. I think this behavior still might cause confusion:

- PR implementation (using `` as suggested): 
![Sem título](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fcd16e45-074a-42a6-ba24-9bdf08e8bfb2)

- Current implementation (using rich hyperlink syntax, the cursor "gets stuck" when moving through `dw`): 
![Sem título](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6a076256-a469-4526-b37d-8c8fcf5bedeb)

comment_data.body:
What seems funny is that some code blocks do not render markdown properly, like this case with the bold indicator `**` . Is this caused by parsing errors?

 
![Sem título](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/49df51a7-92bf-440d-9c2e-1900a8c0935d)

comment_data.body:
> * Current implementation (using rich hyperlink syntax, the cursor "gets stuck" when moving through `dw`):
>   ![Sem título](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/47800334/506006021-6a076256-a469-4526-b37d-8c8fcf5bedeb.jpeg?jwt=eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJpc3MiOiJnaXRodWIuY29tIiwiYXVkIjoicmF3LmdpdGh1YnVzZXJjb250ZW50LmNvbSIsImtleSI6ImtleTUiLCJleHAiOjE3NjE1NzE2NjIsIm5iZiI6MTc2MTU3MTM2MiwicGF0aCI6Ii80NzgwMDMzNC81MDYwMDYwMjEtNmEwNzYyNTYtYTQ2OS00NTI2LWIzN2QtOGM4ZmNmNWJlZGViLmpwZWc_.YWWcYg_HnVYQgLAVfVLLJ4o17T6xNmvmu7ujhNyr35A)

What I mean is to "conceal" the backtick with a space character, not to completely not display it. That requires you to modify the syntax file. Please see `:h conceal` and `:h syntax`.

> What seems funny is that some code blocks do not render markdown properly, like this case with the bold indicator ** .

Tutor is just inspired by markdown, it is neither a subset nor superset of markdown

comment_regular_data.body:
was this part of https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/34643 implemented?

> when users open a tutor with `:Tutor`, should open a copy of the tutor file instead of the original one.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(tutor): removed hyperlinks from tutor lessons, non-interactive practice examples simplified
